question: Ahlam Mosteghanemi is called the world's best-known arabophone woman novelist. What is her nationality?
explanation: Ahlam Mosteghanemi, an Algerian, famous works are "Memory in Flesh", "Chaos of the Senses", "Bed Hopper", "The Art of Forgetting", "Black Suits You So Well". She launched a literacy campaign in Algeria and supervise the distribution of agricultural land to the poorest. She is almost a household name in Algeria because of her daily poetic shows on national radio.
